A remake of Half LIfe that stands out for having a few bugs. Recommended for those who like the Source engine.

Why yes, the bugs can be very annoying, they did fix some things in the long run, like the console commands. Honestly, I only ran into two bugs, one in the Residue Processing chapter, where the screen was giving me a seizure, and two, the gonarch standing in place, and when it tries to attack you, it leaves a black square from where the projectiles hit. Though, the baby headcrabs are still annoying af.  However, the visuals, HL:DMS, and the ragdolls basically make up for it. 7/10

Not many mods for this, it's also not that much better than the original to justify buying this version. Don't make the same mistake I did. And if you want a newer version of halflife, look at Black Mesa (some mods restore more of the original's glory, although I don't necessarily think changes in that game are bad)

Pre-ordered Half-Life 2's special edition so I could get this, seeing how big of a Half-Life fan I was back in 2004-2005. And, this wasn't what I was expecting back then... but I have since warmed up to this port (Ignore the 0.5 hours, for some reason I lost my old HL-2 content when the steam revamp happened).

So what is Half-Life: Source? Basically the exact same game as Half-Life, but with nicer visuals. Think of it as a very light HD Remaster like you see released on PS4 and Xbox One these days.  There isn't any additional content or anything, it is just the old classic with a fresh coat of paint on it. Now it does support the re-worked models from Blue Shift, which I don't remember being a thing at launch.

Not alot else to add really. There are reports of bugs and weird glitches, but I've not really encountered anything myself  when I briefly re-visited it recently.

Would I suggest getting this? Eh, why not? During a sale you can pick up the bundle it's in pretty cheap. But I wouldn't put up the cash otherwise, unless you don't own the other titles included.
I have finished the original I do know how many years ago, I have finished Source a couple of years ago. For me, still the best FPS made.

Ну что можно сказать переход на новый движок удался на 2 , в игре есть множество багов которые валв не фиксят.
Пример : Неотоброжающиеся оружие (модели) ,неотоброжающиеся худ (HUD) и ещё что то с сохранениями , есть проблемы не всегда получается начать игру без вылета после загрузки сохранения , ещё реже но есть баг вылет при использование тату-пушки после чего сохранение тупо ломается моментальный вылет продолжить игру нельзя...
Нет это не самый плохой продукт но всё же игра очень плохо написана на асемблерре лишком много просчётов в вычислениях которые и приводят к этим ошибкам( К сожелению кроме этой игры нету hf1 в высоком разрешение хотя бы тех текстур что здесь хватает всё же лучше оригинала.
P.S: Все баги которые я описал ,были испытаны мною и все они встретились мне ,возможно у вас всё будет лучше не спорю ,но вы скорее всего можете встретится и похоже что тут есть проблема с сохранениями и созданием новой игры ,через раз баги есть ,через раз их нету, я 10 раз начинал и проверял эту дичь вообще hf1 старый добрый hf1 только хуже немного ,купите оригинальный hf и не будет проблем вообще прошёл игра отличная но вот её техническая сторона оставляет лучшего

Flawed, has couple of major bugs, like Tau Cannon occasionally incorrect ricochet angle that's causing massive self-inflicted damage to the player or dodgy hitbox on attack helicopter that causes constant misses.

But it still adds a fresh new visual layer on old experience and if you utterly enjoyed original HL1 to the point that you don't mind couple of difficulty-increasing gameplay bugs (there are few more, but they're relatively minor, compared to the mentioned above) to see old gameplay with slightly better lighting effects - do check it out (worth, at least, the sale price)
Got mine within the Valve Complete Pack package and had a blast playing single player campaign couple of times already.
Be sure to check out Black Mesa as well!

[h1]Half Life: Source (HL:S)[/h1]
[u]Kategorie: Half Life (Remaster)[/u]
Předtím než mně začnete soudit, že dávám zápornou recenzi tak to srovnávám s původním HL.
[h1]Co se změnilo[/h1]
Half Life Source je remaster z gold enginu na source engine ale nečekejte nějaké grafické změny to ne sice Kaňon byl hodně zmeněn (k hnusnějšímu) ale dokonce je tam použitá i Half Life 2 Textura.No ale co dál se změnilo. Voda vypadá více jako voda, "ragdollavost" postav takže a možná přidaly pár bugů. Ano bugů.
V druhé misi vědec levitoval nad židlí a v misi ve  zpracování odpadů mi totálně vybuchla grafika (a neděje se to jenom mně)
[h1]Kladné[/h1]
[u]+ Lepší voda
+ Ragdolly nepřátel viz funny bullsquid
+ Real Time Menu[/u]
[h1]Záporné[/h1]
[u]- Bugy
- Strašně lesklé zbraně a textury
- problémy se Skyboxy
- Otřesný kaňon
- Netváří se jako remaster[/u]
[h1]Závěr[/h1]
Ale upozorňuji že fakt recenzuji změny jinak hra samotná je v poho (příběh,modely a zbraně)

To start, I think this game gets 9/10. The source engine improved this game because it introduced more modern graphics at the time and now this game is a bit more physics reactive so gibs can function "properly" and follow the laws of physics  also the lighting is much more dynamic, the water is also much prettier. The weapons, movement, and HEV suit have been left untouched. The only aspect i'd say in which this game fails is one section in the chapter Unforeseen Consequenses where you have to jump across boxes above a pit of death the boxes will move around a bit when you try to move on them because of the way physics have been changed because of the Source engine, which makes that platforming section quite a bit more difficult than the original, but other than that everything else is great!

да да я

Back in the late '99 or maybe 2000, I owned this game on the original disk.  I still have the disk, but the Steam account used with it has long since vanished from my memory.  But believe it or not, I never could get into this game back then.  I was still too busy playing TF1.

But since that time I have decided to go back and play all of the games that I never had, or possibly did but just didn't play through.  And this game was at the top of my list.  It's amazing how well this game runs to this day.  And while I do still have the proper "Period Correct" computer to play this on, it plays just fine under my newer PC (FX-83XX w/ 8GB RAM & Win10).

Being a proper shooter with a great story line, the Half-Life game I remember has been much better as I have gotten older.  I can appreciate it much more now for what it was; one of the most "modern" of the classic shooters.  With twist at every turn, and an ability to catch you off guard with your ammo rationing, this game is great at making you want to backtrack to aquire more ammo. Having traditionally been a run & gun player, this game forced me to slow down and play.  This help me to appreciate exactly what made this game so special back in the day.

Another upside of this game is the Team Fortress Classic addon.  Which, believe it or not, still has quite a few active players to this day (Apr 2018).  If that doesn't say something about the longevity of this franchise, I don't know what does.

If you've never played it before, I would suggest at least giving it a once over to experience what it was like gaming back at the turn of the century.  Those were in my mind the fondest years in PC Gaming History.

Все мы знаем, что в 1998 году выходит легендарная игра под названием Half-Life, которая превнесла чего-то многое в жанр шутер от первого лица. 1 июня 2004 года перед выходом Half-Life 2, 1-я часть была перенесена на движок Source и я хотел рассказать почему я не рекомендую покупать данную игру. На самом деле Half-Life Source- это та же Half-Life 1, но на движке Source с изменёнными эффектами, с добавлением Ragdollа, с переделанным Skyboxом и с исправлением некоторых скриптов которые в обычной Half-Life они были сделаны криво, но проблема в том, что игра не ремейк 1-й части, а просто перенесённая игра с движка Gold Source на движок Source с кучей багов, ошибок  и недочётов, как например в главе ,,Переработка отходов" в одной локации ломаются эффекты, а в последующей главе на локации со снайпером ломается и Skybox. В целом Half-Life Source это та же самая игра только на движке Source с багами и недочётами в плане некоторых уровней которые терпится исправить. P.S это мой первый обзор так что не судите строго.

Самая лучшая игра всех времён. Огромное количество врагов, оригинальный сюжет, увлекательный геймплэй закрывают нам глаза на графику, хотя в следующих частях игры графика стала в разы лучше. Игру однозначно стоит приобрести и поиграть всем геймерам.

This game hasn't aged well at all. When am I supposed to have fun? Is it when I'm running around nonsensical maze-like tunnels, trying to find the right switch, just so I can backtrack halfway across the level to find a door that magically opened? The combat can be kind of fun, except for the fact that the enemies will hitscan you all the time and it's always interrupted by horrible platforming sections, terrible puzzles and maze-like levels made for rats. This sort of thing destroys the pacing and any possible enjoyment you could have in this game. There are no interesting characters or story here, just rats. This is a rat game. Thank you Valve.

Frankly, I'm disappointed. Half-Life really could've benefited from Source's physics and lighting engine, as well as superior sound quality. Too bad this is a half-assed, buggy port, with specular lighting on textures that's honestly kind of ugly. Not to mention shoddy audio mixing, along with AI that's somehow dummer than the original's. If you have $10 and you have to choose between this, and the original GoldSrc version, go for the Goldsrc version.

This has been broken for quite a while. To be quick about it, the tentacle doesn't function, chrome textures look horrible, and the included HD pack came straight from Gamebanana, with enhanced textures by various authors, such as Romka and Stone.
Valve abandoned this game in 2013 and left it in a broken state. They shouldn't even still be selling it, and no one who doesn't already have it should buy it, unless they just want the content for Garry's Mod or something.

I'll begin with the conclusion: the only good thing about this game is that it's Half-Life.

This is an amazingly slapdash port of the original Half-Life to Source, the revolutionary game engine that's most famous for its use in Half-Life 2. If you're expecting the same level of quality from HL:S as HL2, you will be bitterly disappointed.
This is not a total conversion; it's just the original Half-Life on an engine it wasn't designed for. As such, the physics of Source aren't put to any sort of interesting use in this game, and at times end up completely broken. While ladders are universally a pain in Source games, here I actually cringe in dread any time I have to use them. When I reach the top of a ladder, for some reason I'll often launch off of it, missing what I was climbing to and taking fall damage. Why wasn't this fixed in playtesting? Was this game playtested?
There are more bugs than that, though. For example, if you press the button for a blast door when it hasn't finished closing, the button will remain in that state and become useless, preventing you from progressing. Also, the Tentacles deal 0 damage, making Blast Pit, one of the most tense portions of the original game, a complete joke.
The AI just sucks. The graphics aren't improved from the original, which makes it look hideous for a 2004 game. I could go on, but you get the point. It's just a mess overall.

While this game isn't offensively bad, its only saving grace is that it's Half-Life. If you want the best possible Half-Life experience, play Black Mesa (though, as of me writing this, the Xen levels still haven't been released yet). If you want to play the original Half-Life, just play the original Half-Life. There's no significant reason to play this game, unless you've just been playing both those versions nonstop and want something a bit different.

[h1]5/10, at least it's Half-Life.[/h1]
